required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Incidence, Clinical Characteristics and Economic Burden of Dengue in Brazilian Children
clinical_study.official_title: An Epidemiological Study to Evaluate the Incidence, Clinical Characteristics and Economic Burden of Dengue in Brazilian Children

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to establish an active surveillance in order to generate dengue disease burden estimates including incidence rates, prevalence data, clinical presentation and cost of illness in Forteleza (Brazil).

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective cohort study.
The study period initially planned to be two years, is extended by one year to cover one additional dengue season.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection Cases
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory-confirmed dengue infection refers to suspected symptomatic dengue cases with positive dengue virus identification or serologic evidence of dengue infection through Reverse Transcriptase quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) from first blood sample or anti-dengue Immunoglobulin type M/G (IgM/G) seroconversions between first and second blood sampling.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Virus Cases
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory-confirmed dengue infection refers to suspected symptomatic dengue cases with positive dengue virus identification or serologic evidence of dengue infection through Reverse Transcriptase quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) from first blood sample or anti-dengue Immunoglobulin type M/G (IgM/G) seroconversions between first and second blood sampling.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Cases
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory-confirmed dengue infection refers to suspected symptomatic dengue cases with positive dengue virus identification or serologic evidence of dengue infection through Reverse Transcriptase quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) from first blood sample or anti-dengue Immunoglobulin type M/G (IgM/G) seroconversions between first and second blood sampling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Immunoglobulin Type G (IgG) Antibodies Against Dengue
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response against dengue was assessed via Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Asymptomatic Dengue Primary Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Asymptomatic dengue primary infection was defined as a documented seroconversion (anti-dengue IgG antibodies) between two sequential sera samples obtained during the scheduled visits, without suspicion of dengue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Laboratory Confirmed and Probable Dengue Cases
secondary_outcome.description: A case of primary or secondary symptomatic dengue infection was defined as laboratory confirmed or probable symptomatic dengue case whose previous sample collected at scheduled Visits 1- 4 (Day 0- Year 3) to detect anti-dengue IgG antibodies was seronegative or seropositive, respectively. A probable dengue case was defined as a suspected symptomatic dengue case with the following laboratory findings: -anti-dengue IgM or anti-dengue IgG positivity in at least one sample (in either blood sample 1 or 2); no evidence of viremia (negative dengue virus identification through RT-qPCR) in blood sample 1; and no evidence of anti-dengue Ig M or IgG seroconversion between blood sample 1 and blood sample 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Dengue Infection Cases by Virus Type (DENV)
secondary_outcome.description: Among virus types causing dengue infection were DENV-4 in 2012 and 2013 and DENV-1 in 2014, as assessed by PCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Primary Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection Cases
secondary_outcome.description: Primary symptomatic dengue infection cases are defined as laboratory confirmed symptomatic dengue cases whose previous sample collected at scheduled visits to detect anti-dengue IgG antibodies were seronegative or seropositive, respectively. Analysis was done by calendar year and age strata.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Secondary Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection Cases
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary symptomatic dengue infection cases are defined as laboratory confirmed symptomatic dengue cases whose previous sample collected at scheduled visits to detect anti-dengue IgG antibodies were seronegative or seropositive, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Working Days Missed of Primary Care Giver 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 35 post laboratory confirmed dengue onset
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days off work from caregiver were recorded as part of health economics indirect resource utilization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Caregiver Absenteeism Associated With Subject Dengue Illness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 35 post laboratory confirmed dengue onset
secondary_outcome.description: The number of suspected dengue infections with primary caregivers missing from work was recorded as part of health economics indirect resource utilization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of School Days Missed by Subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 35 post laboratory confirmed dengue onset
secondary_outcome.description: The number of school days missed by subjects due to dengue infection were recorded as part of the dengue active surveillance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects Absenteeism Associated With Dengue Illness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 35 post laboratory confirmed dengue onset
secondary_outcome.description: The number of suspected dengue infections with subjects missing from school due to dengue infection were recorded as part of the dengue active surveillance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Direct Medical Resource Associated With Suspected Dengue Cases
secondary_outcome.description: Direct medical resource included hospitalization, stay in intensive care units (ICU), medications, diagnostic and therapeutic procedures

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalization Days Due to Suspected Dengue Cases
secondary_outcome.description: Length of hospitalization was part of the direct medical resource, associated with dengue infection.
Temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius (Â°C), was among symptoms of symptomatic dengue infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Dengue Episodes With Any Temperature Interval
secondary_outcome.description: Temperature intervals assessed varied from hypothermia 33.5 to 36.4 degrees Celsius (Â°C), to normal temperature 36.5-35.9 Â°C and hyperthermia 37 - 39.9 Â°C, or were unknown.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Dengue Episodes Associated With Clinical Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Dengue related clinical symptoms included general symptoms, digestive symptoms, respiratory symptoms, hemorrhagic symptoms and any other signs among first symptoms.

arm_group.description: Children age 5 to 13 years at the time of enrollment, selected from schools in Fortaleza.

intervention.description: Socio-demographic information, medical history, yellow fever vaccination history and dengue suspicion data collection.

A blood sample will be collected at each of the three scheduled study visits and any time during the study that dengue is suspected. Samples collected at scheduled visits will be tested for anti-dengue antibodies. Samples collected at visits for dengue suspicion will be tested for dengue diagnosis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female between 5 and 13 years of age (including children at least 5 years of age and excluding children who reached their fourteenth birthday) at the time of enrollment.
- Written informed consent (and assent when applicable).
- Subjects who the investigator believes that they and/or their parent(s)/LAR can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol (e.g. willingness to do a hospital visit in case of dengue suspicion, willingness to attend the study hospital return for follow-up visits, able to observe for signs of dengue, understand how to take a temperature, etc).
- Subjects who plan to attend one of the study schools for two school years following enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects planning to move from the study area during the two school years following enrollment.
- Child in care.
- Enrollment in another study that would conflict with the current study.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of 2117 subjects originally enrolled in the study, one subject was excluded due to protocol violation.

group.title: Dengue Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 5-13 years at time of enrollment, enrolled for data collection and blood sampling for dengue evaluation, from Day 0 to Year 3.

group.title: Dengue Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 5-13 years, enrolled for data collection and blood sampling for dengue evaluation, from Day 0 to Year 3.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Laboratory Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection Cases
outcome.description: Laboratory-confirmed dengue infection refers to suspected symptomatic dengue cases with positive dengue virus identification or serologic evidence of dengue infection through Reverse Transcriptase quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) from first blood sample or anti-dengue Immunoglobulin type M/G (IgM/G) seroconversions between first and second blood sampling.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort, which included all subjects meeting all eligibility criteria of the study, with no elimination criteria during the study and complying with the procedures defined in the protocol.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events were collected throughout the study period (from Day 0 to Year 3).
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events were not collected as blood sampling was the only invasive procedure performed.

group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 5-13 years at time of enrollment, enrolled for data collection and blood sampling for dengue evaluation, from Day 0 to Year 3.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
